title: Kalyani (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Kalyani (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="Nadia%20district">Nadia district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. The seat is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>. This constituency was constituted in 2011, as per orders of the Delimitation Commission.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, No. 92 Kalyani (Vidhan Sabha constituency) (SC) is composed of the following: <a href="Kalyani%2C%20West%20Bengal">Kalyani</a> municipality, <a href="Gayespur">Gayespur</a> municipality and Chanduria II, Kanchrapara, Madanpur I, Madanpur II, Saguna, Sarati and Simurali <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Chakdaha%20%28Community%20development%20block%29">Kalyani</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>.
Kalyani (Vidhan Sabha constituency) (SC) is part of No. 14 <a href="Bangaon%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Bangaon (Lok Sabha constituency)</a> (SC).
Election results.
2021.
 
2011.
In the 2011 election, Ramendranath Biswas of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival Jyotsna Sikdar of CPI(M).
 
2006.
